statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Ahmad Thomas scored 19 points with six steals and seven rebounds, and Zilli Giacomo added 11 points as UNC-Asheville defeated Division II Brevard College 68-50 on Tuesday night.
article.headline: Thomas scores 19, UNC-Asheville tops Brevard College 68-50
article.linkText: Thomas scores 19, UNC-Asheville tops Brevard College 68-50
article.story: ASHEVILLE, N.C. -- Ahmad Thomas scored 19 points with six steals and seven rebounds, and Zilli Giacomo added 11 points as UNC-Asheville defeated Division II Brevard College 68-50 on Tuesday night. Raekwon Miller also scored 11 for the Bulldogs (4-3) making three of six 3-pointers and grabbing seven boards -- all off the defensive glass. Brevard, which is transitioning from D-II to D-III, was led by Omar El Diraoui's 11 points and 10 from D.J. Bostick. Brevard has yet to win a game this season. Thomas has scored in double figures in all seven games this season for UNC-Asheville, which was coming off a 95-57 loss at then No. 5 Kansas. He added six steals against Brevard. Alec Wnuk and MaCio Teague each scored seven points for the Bulldogs, who shot 46 percent from the field (24-52).
